page.title: 11METHODIST CHURCH,BURRINGTON
page.content: The{Bible Christians}were a Methodist denomination founded in 1815 in North Devon and North Cornwall. At first Burrington members held meetings in private houses, then in{1829}Hugh Ford bought two cottages for a Bible Christian chapel. This is the present building, though it has been altered substantially since.In{1907}the Bible Christians became part of the United Methodist Church. There were then 100 members in Burrington.Many preachers arrived on horseback and used to stable their horses at "Homelands".The burial ground was dedicated in {1933.}Burrington is in the Ringsash Circuit, and its Minister is the Rev. Thomas Drew.Services are held at 11a.m and 6.30 p.m. Sunday School is at 11.15a.m. and fortnightly meetings are on Tuesdays.
